The resistance of an entire plant species against all isolates of particular pathogens is called nonhost resistance
1 . Colletotrichum tropicale (hereafter Ctro), formally called C. gleosporioides, is a hemibiotrophic fungal pathogen that causes anthracnose on its host mulberry; however, it is not able to enter the nonhost Arabidopsis because Arabidopsis blocks pathogen entry via activation of preinvasive resistance. Preinvasive resistance of Arabidopsis against Ctro involves PENETRATION2 ( PEN2) and PEN3
